metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Node.js MySQL Select From
Selecting From a Table
To select data from a table in MySQL, use the "SELECT" statement.
content.html: To select data from a table in MySQL, use the "SELECT" statement.

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  con.query("SELECT * FROM customers", function (err, result, fields) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(result);
  });
});

content.text: SELECT * will return all columns
Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_select.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.text: Selecting Columns
To select only some of the columns in a table, use the "SELECT" statement followed by the column name.
content.html: To select only some of the columns in a table, use the "SELECT" statement followed by the column name.

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  con.query("SELECT name, address FROM customers", function (err, result, fields) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(result);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select2.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select2.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_select2.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.text: The Result Object
As you can see from the result of the example above, the result object is an array containing each row as an object.
content.html: As you can see from the result of the example above, the result object is an array containing each row as an object.

content.text: To return e.g. the address of the third record, just refer to the third array object's address property:
content.html: To return e.g. the address of the third record, just refer to the third array object's address property:

content.text: Which will produce this result:
The Fields Object
The third parameter of the callback function is an array containing information about each field in the result.
content.html: The third parameter of the callback function is an array containing information about each field in the result.

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  con.query("SELECT name, address FROM customers", function (err, result, fields) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(fields);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select_fields.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_select_fields.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_select_fields.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:
